v.v: The proverbs of Solomon.
Treasures accumulated by wickedness have no value,
Yahweh does not let the soul of the righteous person go hungry,
A lazy hand causes a person to be poor,
A wise son gathers a crop in the summer,
Gifts from God are upon the head of the righteous person,
The righteous person makes those who remember him happy,
Those who are sensible accept commands,
He who walks in integrity walks in safety,
He who winks the eye causes grief,
The mouth of the righteous person is a water spring of life,
Hatred stirs up conflicts,
Wisdom is found on the lips of a discerning person,
Wise men store up knowledge,
The wealth of a rich man is his fortified city;
The wage of the righteous person leads to life;
There is a path to life for the one who follows discipline,
Whoever conceals hatred has lying lips,
When there are many words, transgression is not lacking,
The tongue of the righteous person is pure silver;
The lips of the righteous person nourish many,
The good gifts of Yahweh bring wealth
Wickedness is a game a fool plays,
The fear of the wicked person will overtake him,
The wicked are like the storm that passes by, and they are no more,
Like vinegar on the teeth and smoke in the eyes,
The fear of Yahweh prolongs life,
The hope of righteous people is their joy,
The way of Yahweh protects those who have integrity,
The righteous person will never be overthrown,
Out of the mouth of the righteous person comes the fruit of wisdom,
The lips of the righteous person know what is acceptable,
Yahweh hates scales that are not accurate,
When pride comes, then comes disgrace,
The integrity of the upright guides them,
Wealth is worthless on the day of wrath,
The right conduct of a blameless person makes his way straight,
The right conduct of those who please God keeps them safe,
When a wicked man dies, his hope perishes
The righteous person is kept away from trouble
With his mouth the godless person destroys his neighbor,
When righteous people prosper, a city rejoices;
Through the good gifts of those who please God, the city becomes great;
The man who has contempt for his friend has no sense,
Whoever goes around slandering reveals secrets,
Where there is no wise direction, a nation falls,
Whoever guarantees a loan for a stranger will surely suffer harm,
A gracious woman gets honor,
A kind person benefits himself,
The wicked person lies to get his wages,
An honest person who does what is right will live,
Yahweh hates those whose hearts are perverse,
Be sure of this—the wicked person will not go unpunished,
Like a gold ring in a pig’s nose
The desires of righteous people result in good,
There is one who scatters—he will accumulate even more;
The generous person will prosper
People curse the man who refuses to sell grain,
The one who diligently seeks good is also seeking favor,
Those who trust in their riches will fall,
The one who brings trouble on his own household will inherit the wind
The righteous person will be like a tree of life,
Behold! The righteous person receives what he deserves;
Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,
Yahweh gives favor to a good man,
A person cannot be established by wickedness,
A worthy wife is her husband’s crown,
The plans of the righteous are just,
The words of wicked people are an ambush waiting for a chance to kill,
Wicked people are overthrown and they are gone,
A person is praised by how much wisdom he has,
Better to have an unimportant position—only being a servant—
The righteous person cares about the needs of his animal,
The one who works his land will have plenty of food,
The wicked person desires what evil men have stolen from others,
An evil person is trapped by his wicked talk,
From the fruit of his words a person is filled with good things,
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
A fool shows his anger at once,
The one who speaks the truth says what is right,
The words of one who speaks rashly are like the thrusts of a sword,
Truthful lips last forever,
There is deceit in the hearts of those who plan to do evil,
No ill comes on the righteous person,
Yahweh hates lying lips,
A prudent man conceals his knowledge,
The hand of the diligent will rule,
Anxiety in the heart of a person weighs him down,
The righteous person is a guide for his friend,
Lazy people would not roast their own game,
Those who walk in the right way find life
A wise son hears his father’s instruction,
From the fruit of his mouth a person enjoys good things,
The one who guards his mouth protects his life,
The appetite of lazy people craves but gets nothing,
The righteous person hates lies,
Righteousness protects those who are faultless in their path,
There is someone who enriches himself, but has nothing at all,
The ransom of a rich man’s life is his wealth,
The light of righteous people rejoices,
Pride only breeds conflict,
Wealth dwindles away when there is too much vanity,
When hope is postponed, it breaks the heart,
Whoever despises instruction brings destruction on himself,
The teaching of a wise person is a fountain of life,
Good insight wins favor,
Prudent people act out of knowledge in every decision,
A wicked messenger falls into trouble,
The one who ignores instruction will have poverty and shame,
A longing realized is sweet to the appetite,
Walk with wise people and you will be wise,
Disaster runs after sinners,
A good person leaves an inheritance for his grandchildren,
An unplowed field owned by the poor could produce much food,
The one who does not discipline his son hates him,
The righteous person eats until he satisfies his appetite,
The wise woman builds her house,
The one who walks uprightly fears Yahweh,
From the mouth of a fool comes a rod for his back,
Where there are no cattle the feeding trough is clean,
A faithful witness does not lie,
A mocker seeks wisdom and there is none,
Walk away from a foolish person,
The wisdom of the prudent person is to understand his own way,
Fools mock when the guilt offering is sacrificed,
The heart knows its own bitterness
The house of wicked people will be destroyed,
There is a way that seems right to a man,
A heart can laugh but still be in pain
The one who is not faithful will get what his ways deserve,
The one who is naive believes everything,
A wise man fears and turns away from evil,
One who is quick to become angry does foolish things,
The naive inherit foolishness,
Evil people will bow down before those who are good
The poor person is hated even by his own companions,
The one who shows contempt for his neighbor is sinning,
Do not those who plot evil go astray?
With all hard work comes a profit,
The crown of wise people is their wealth,
A truthful witness saves lives,
When someone fears Yahweh, he also has much confidence in him;
The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life,
The glory of a king is found in the great number of his people,
A patient person has great understanding,
A tranquil heart is life for the body,
The one who oppresses the poor curses his Maker,
The wicked person is brought down by his evil actions,
Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning,
Doing what is right exalts a nation,
The favor of the king is with the servant who acts prudently,
A gentle answer turns away wrath,
The tongue of wise people compliments knowledge,
The eyes of Yahweh are everywhere,
A healing tongue is a tree of life,
A fool has contempt for his father’s instruction,
In the house of the righteous person there is great treasure,
The lips of wise people scatter knowledge about,
Yahweh hates the sacrifices of wicked people,
Yahweh hates the way of wicked people,
Harsh discipline awaits anyone who forsakes the way
Sheol and destruction are open before Yahweh;
The mocker resents correction;
A joyful heart makes the face cheerful,
The heart of the discerning seeks knowledge,
All the days of oppressed people are miserable,
Better is little with the fear of Yahweh
Better is a meal with vegetables where there is love
An angry man stirs up arguments,
The path of the sluggard is like a place with a hedge of thorns,
A wise son brings joy to his father,
Folly delights a person who lacks sense,
Plans go wrong where there is no advice,
A person finds joy when he gives a pertinent reply;
The path of life leads upward for prudent people,
Yahweh tears down the house of the proud,
Yahweh hates the thoughts of wicked people,
The robber brings trouble to his family,
The heart of the righteous person ponders before it answers,
Yahweh is far away from wicked people,
The light of the eyes brings joy to the heart
If you pay attention when someone corrects how you live,
The one who rejects discipline despises himself,
The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom
The plans of the heart belong to a person,
All of a person’s ways are pure in his own eyes,
Commit your works to Yahweh
Yahweh has made everything for its purpose,
Yahweh hates everyone who has an arrogant heart,
By covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness iniquity is atoned for
When a person’s ways are pleasing to Yahweh,
Better is a little with what is right,
In his heart a person plans out his way,
Insightful decisions are on the lips of a king,
Honest scales come from Yahweh;
When kings do wicked things, that is something to be despised,
A king delights in lips that say what is right
A king’s wrath is a messenger of death
In the light of a king’s face is life
How much better it is to get wisdom than gold.
The highway of upright people turns away from evil;
Pride comes before destruction
It is better to be humble among poor people
Whoever contemplates what they are taught will find what is good,
The one who is wise in heart is called discerning
Understanding is a fountain of life to the one who has it,
The heart of a wise person gives insight to his mouth
Pleasant words are a honeycomb—
There is a way that seems right to a man,
The laborer’s appetite works for him;
A worthless person digs up mischief
A perverse person stirs up conflict
A man of violence lies to his neighbor
The one who winks the eye is plotting perverse things;
Gray hair is a crown of glory;
It is better to be slow to anger than to be a warrior
The lots are cast into the lap,
It is better to have quiet with a dry morsel of bread
A wise servant will rule over a son who acts shamefully
The crucible is for silver and the furnace is for gold,
The evildoer pays attention to wicked lips;
Whoever mocks the poor insults his Maker
Grandchildren are the crown of the aged
Eloquent speech is not suitable for a fool;
A bribe is like a magic stone to the one who gives it;
Whoever overlooks an offense seeks love,
A rebuke goes deeper into a person who has understanding
An evil person only seeks rebellion,
It is better to meet a bear robbed of her cubs
When someone returns evil for good,
The beginning of conflict is like one who releases water everywhere,
The person who acquits the wicked person and the person who condemns the righteous person—
Why should a fool pay money to learn about wisdom,
A friend is loving at all times
A man having no sense makes binding promises
Whoever loves conflict loves sin;
A person who has a crooked heart finds nothing that is good;
Whoever is the parent of a fool brings grief to himself;
A cheerful heart is good medicine,
A wicked man accepts a secret bribe
The one who has understanding sets his face toward wisdom,
A foolish son is a grief to his father
Also, it is never good to punish the righteous person;
One who has knowledge uses few words
Even a fool is thought to be wise if he keeps silent;
One who isolates himself seeks his own desire
A fool finds no pleasure in understanding,
When a wicked person comes, contempt comes with him—
The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters;
It is not good to be partial to the wicked person,
A fool’s lips bring him conflict
A fool’s mouth is his ruin
The words of a gossip are like delicious morsels
Also, one who is slack in his work
The name of Yahweh is a strong tower;
The wealth of the rich is his fortified city
Before his downfall a person’s heart is proud,
One who answers before listening—
A person’s spirit will survive sickness,
The heart of the intelligent acquires knowledge
A man’s gift may open the way
The first to plead his case seems right
Casting the lot settles disputes
An offended brother is harder to be won than a strong city,
From the fruit of his mouth one’s stomach is filled;
Death and life are controlled by the tongue,
He who finds a wife finds a good thing
A poor person pleads for mercy,
The one who claims many friends is brought to ruin by them,
Better is a poor person who walks in his integrity
Also, it is not good to have desire without knowledge
A person’s folly ruins his life
Wealth adds many friends,
A false witness will not go unpunished
Many will ask for a favor from a generous person
All the brothers of a poor man hate him;
He who gets wisdom loves his own life;
A false witness will not go unpunished,
It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury—
Discretion makes a person slow to anger
The wrath of the king is like the roaring of a young lion,
A foolish son is ruin to his father
A house and wealth are inherited from parents,
Laziness throws a person into a deep sleep,
The one who obeys the command guards his life,
Whoever is kind to the poor lends to Yahweh
Discipline your son while there is hope
A hot-tempered person must pay the penalty;
Listen to advice and accept instruction,
Many are the plans in a person’s heart,
Loyalty is what a person desires
Honor for Yahweh leads people to life;
The sluggard buries his hand in the dish;
Strike a mocker, and the naive person will become prudent;
The one who robs his father and chases his mother away
If you cease to hear instruction, my son,
A corrupt witness mocks justice
Condemnation is ready for mockers
Wine is a mocker and strong drink is a brawler;
The fear of a king is like the fear of a young lion that is roaring;
It is an honor for anyone to avoid conflict,
The lazy person does not plow in autumn;
The purpose in a human heart is like deep water,
Many a person proclaims he is loyal,
The righteous person walks in his integrity,
A king who sits on the throne performing the duties of a judge
Who can say, “I have kept my heart pure;
Differing weights and unequal measures—
Even a youth is known by his actions,
Ears that hear and eyes that see—
Do not love sleep or you will come to poverty;
“Bad! Bad!” says the buyer,
There is gold and an abundance of costly stones,
Take a garment of one who has put up security for a stranger,
Bread gained by deceit tastes sweet,
Plans are established by advice
A gossip reveals secrets
If a person curses his father or his mother,
An inheritance gained quickly at the beginning
Do not say, “I will pay you back for this wrong!”
Yahweh hates unequal weights
A person’s steps are directed by Yahweh;
It is a snare for a person to say rashly, “This thing is holy,”
A wise king winnows the wicked
The spirit of a person is the lamp of Yahweh,
Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness preserve the king;
The glory of young men is their strength
Blows that make a wound cleanse away evil
The king’s heart is a stream of water in the hand of Yahweh;
Every person’s way is right in his own eyes,
To do what is right and just
Haughty eyes and a proud heart—
The plans of the diligent lead only to prosperity,
Acquiring riches by a lying tongue
The violence of the wicked will drag them away,
The way of a guilty person is crooked,
It is better to live on a corner of the roof
The appetite of the wicked craves evil;
When the mocker is punished, the naive become wise,
The righteous person watches the house of the wicked person;
The one who shuts his ears to the cry of the poor,
A gift in secret appeases anger
When justice is done, it brings joy to the righteous person,
The one who wanders from the way of understanding,
Whoever loves pleasure will become poor;
A wicked person is ransom for the righteous person,
It is better to live in the desert
Desirable treasure and oil are kept in the dwelling of the wise,
The one who does right and is kind—
A wise man scales the city of the mighty ones,
Whoever guards his mouth and tongue
The proud and haughty person—”Mocker” is his name—
The desire of the lazy kills him,
All day long he craves and craves more,
The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable;
A false witness will perish,
A wicked man makes his face hard,
There is no wisdom, there is no understanding, and there is no advice
The horse is prepared for the day of battle,
A good name is to be chosen over great riches
Rich and poor people have this in common—
A prudent man sees trouble and hides himself,
The reward for humility and fear of Yahweh
Thorns and snares lie in the path of the perverse;
Teach a child the way he should go
Rich people rule over poor people
He who sows injustice will reap trouble
The one who has a generous eye will be blessed,
Drive away the mocker, and out goes strife;
The one who loves a pure heart
The eyes of Yahweh keep watch over knowledge,
The lazy person says, “There is a lion in the street!
The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit;
Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child,
The one who oppresses poor people to increase his wealth,
Incline your ear and listen to the words of the wise
for it will be pleasant for you if you keep them within you,
So your trust may be in Yahweh,
Have I not written for you thirty sayings
to teach you truth in these trustworthy words,
Do not rob the poor because he is poor,
for Yahweh will plead their case,
Do not make a friend of someone who is ruled by anger
or you will learn his ways
Do not be one who strikes hands in making a pledge,
If you lack the means to pay,
Do not remove the ancient boundary stone
Do you see a man skilled at his work? He will stand before kings;
When you sit to eat with a ruler,
and put a knife to your throat
Do not crave his delicacies,
Do not work too hard to gain wealth;
Will you let your eyes light upon it?
Do not eat the food of one with an evil eye—
for he is the kind of man who counts the price of the food.
You will vomit up the little you have eaten
Do not speak in the hearing of a fool,
Do not move an ancient boundary stone
for their Redeemer is strong
Apply your heart to instruction
Do not withhold instruction from a child,
It is you who must beat him with the rod
My son, if your heart is wise,
my inmost being will rejoice
Do not let your heart envy sinners,
Surely there is a future
Hear—you!—my son, and be wise
Do not associate with drunkards,
for the drunkard and the glutton become poor
Listen to your father who begot you
Buy the truth, but do not sell it;
The father of the righteous person will greatly rejoice,
Let your father and your mother be glad
My son, give me your heart
For a prostitute is a deep pit,
She lies in wait like a robber
Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has fights?
Those who linger over wine,
Do not look at the wine when it is red,
In the last it bites like a serpent
Your eyes will see strange things
You will be as one who sleeps on the high seas
“They hit me,” you will say, “but I was not hurt.
Do not be envious of those who are evil,
because their hearts plot violence
Through wisdom a house is built
By knowledge the rooms are filled
A warrior of wisdom is strong,
for by wise direction you can wage your war
Wisdom is too high for a fool;
There is one who plans to do evil—
A foolish plan is sin
If you become weak with fear in the day of trouble,
Rescue those who are being taken away to death
If you say, “Behold, we knew nothing about this,”
My son, eat honey because it is good,
Such is wisdom for your soul—
Do not lie in wait like the wicked person
For the righteous person falls down seven times and rises again,
Do not celebrate when your enemy falls
or Yahweh will see and disapprove
Do not worry because of evildoers,
for the evil person has no future
Fear Yahweh, and fear the king, my son;
for suddenly their disaster will come

v: A wise son makes his father rejoice
but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
but doing what is right keeps you from death.
but he frustrates the cravings of the wicked.
but the hand of the diligent person gains riches.
but it is disgraceful for him to sleep during harvest.
but the mouth of the wicked covers up violence.
but the name of the wicked will rot away.
but a talkative fool will come to ruin.
but the one who makes his ways crooked, he will be found out.
but a talkative fool will be thrown down.
but the mouth of the wicked covers up violence.
but love covers over all offenses.
but a rod is for the back of the one who has no sense.
but the mouth of a fool brings destruction near.
the poverty of the poor is their destruction.
the profit of the wicked leads them to sin.
but the one who rejects correction is led astray.
and whoever spreads slander is a fool.
but he who is careful in what he says is wise.
there is little value in the heart of the wicked.
but fools die because of their lack of sense.
and he adds no pain to it.
but wisdom is a pleasure to a man of understanding.
but the desire of righteous people will be granted.
but the righteous person is a foundation that lasts forever.
so is the sluggard to those who send him.
but the years of the wicked will be short.
but the years of wicked people will be short.
but it is destruction for the wicked.
but the wicked will not remain in the land.
but the perverse tongue will be cut out.
but the mouth of the wicked, they know what is perverse.
